description.narrative:
Insatsen avser stöd till Internews projekt Aswatouna - Our Voices som syftar till att stärka och utöka kvinnors röster i Irak. Projektet kommer också att bidra till Internews pågående insatser globalt att förbättra tillgången till information som en grund för att göra det möjligt för kvinnor och män att fatta välgrundade beslut, delta i dialog och stå upp för sina rättigheter.
Projektet har följande mål:
- Öka kapaciteten hos journalister och organisationer i det civila samhället för att kunna producera innehåll av hög kvalitet som förstärker kvinnors röster, tar upp kvinnors frågor och ger information som möter kvinnors behov.
- Öka närvaron av kvinnor i media och i den offentliga debatten.
- Stärka kvinnliga journalister och CSO-ledares motståndskraft och förmåga att skydda sig mot könsrelaterade digitala attacker.
- Stödja kvinnors egenmakt genom att bygga upp deras möjligheter till ledarskap inom media och information.
- Informera och utbilda irakiska kvinnor om deras politiska och ekonomiska rättigheter samt vikten av kvinnors politiska och ekonomiska deltagande.
Sida avser att bidra med totalt 32 150 000 SEK under 2019-2021.

Internews Europe has applied to Sida for funding of 32 150 000 SEK to carry out the Aswatouna - Our Voices. Elevating and Amplifying Women's voices in Iraq during the period 2019-2021.
The goal of the intervention is to empower women to participate equally as citizens and decision-makers by strengthening and expanding women's voices in Iraq. The project will also contribute to Internews ongoing efforts globally to improve access to information as a root solution to enable women and men to make informed decisions, participate in dialogue and stand up for their rights

The goal of the project Aswatouna" (our voices) is to empower women to participate equally as citizens and decision-makers by strengthening and expanding women's voices in Iraq. The project will also contribute to Internews ongoing efforts globally to improve access to information as a root solution to enable women and men to make informed decisions, participate in dialogue and stand up for their rights.
Strategic project objectives are: 1) Increase the capacity of journalists and civil society organizations (CSOs) to produce high quality inclusive content which is gender-sensitive, amplifies women's voices, addresses women's issues and provides information which meets women's needs; 2) Increase presence of women's voices in the media and public debate; 3) Strengthen women journalist and CSO leader's resilience against and ability to protect themselves from gender-based digital attacks; 4) Support women's empowerment by building their leadership opportunities in the media and information space and; 5) Inform and educate Iraqi women on their political and economic rights and the importance of women's political and economical participation.

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

tag.narrative: 16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The second phase of the project (2020) saw the emergence and rapid spread ofCOVID-19 pandemic in Iraq, resulting in the death of over 12 000 Iraquis by the end of the year, and the imposition of lock-downs and curfew. Furthermore, movement restrictions aimed at curbing the spread of the virus, led to rise in frequency and severity of violence in the home (GBV), affecting many women and girls. 2020 also witnessed an intensification of political repression and human rights violations. Due to the deteriorating situation in Iraq Internews had to suspend temporary all project activities that required staff travel and/or beneficiaries movements, in order to analyse the situation and to plan pivoting to remote online implementation. Despite all challenges there have been important strides in the project. Some of the project results during 2020 are: Female journalists who participated in the trainings on "Gender Sensitive reporting" have gained confidence, awareness and skills and have now capacity to deal with taboo topics that they may have been uncomfortable or unable to cover prior to the training, including LGBTIQ issues, child marriage and domestic violence. The willingness of news agencies to publish these stories demonstrate clear strides towards women reclaiming public space and fully engaging in issues of their rights, needs and decisions. Journalists in Iraq continue to come under threat by the government, armed groups, and the conservative social culture. To ensure that women journalists ar better equipped to prevent and/or mitigate online and offline gender-based attacks, the project has implemented trainings on digital and physical security and on psychosocial and stress management skills; increasing the participants resilience and ability to work under difficult conditions. In 2020 the project was able to in a participatory way elaborate and publish the document "Ethical Guidelines for Reporting SGBV in the Media". The document was acknowledged by both Iraqi and KRI journalist syndicates.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
